alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 8:16PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Sutter, south central Butte and west central Yuba Counties through 900 PM PDT... At 815 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gridley, or 9 miles southwest of Palermo, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Oroville, Marysville, Palermo, Gridley, Thermalito, Iowa City, Bangor, South Oroville, Biggs and Loma Rica. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
